agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing services to those with substance use dependency.
service_description: Provides assistance to individuals, friends, and family members impacted by substance use dependency. Services include education, social events, life skills class, and referrals for treatment, support groups, food, transportation, and employment.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Visit website or call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A community action agency that works with partners to promote economic self-reliance and build community wealth.
site_name: SOUTH CENTRAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM - BROWN COUNTY
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Brown County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently CLOSED. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Call or visit the website to apply for the waitlist.
site_eligibility: Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Offers curbside pickup of requested library materials to residents of Brown County.
site_details: Place holds by logging in to your account online or by calling 812-988-2850.
site_eligibility: Living in Brown County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information. www.browncountylibrary.info
site_schedule:
Tues 2pm-5pm; Wed and Thurs 3pm-6pm -- 
June-Aug Sat 10am-1pm

Tues 2pm-5pm; Wed and Thurs 3pm-6pm -- 
June-Aug Sat 10am-1pm
site_eligibility: Living in Brown County

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Brown County.
service_description: Offers weather alert radios to Brown County persons in need, while supplies last. Weather alert radios provide information for emergencies including hazardous weather, local area warnings, and current weather conditions from the National Weather Service.
site_details: Call for availability or to make a request.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours
Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours
Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours
Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours
Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours
Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open --Homeowners--Mobile home occupants--Low income

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Brown County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies; call for details.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_name: BROWN COUNTY MOTHER'S CUPBOARD COMMUNITY KITCHEN
agency_desc: Provides a free hot meal and food pantry to anyone in need.
site_name: BROWN COUNTY MOTHER'S CUPBOARD COMMUNITY KITCHEN
service_description: Provides food when available to people in need. Open service area. Volunteers are always needed.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: BROWN COUNTY SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT DISTRICT
agency_desc: Reduces the amount of recyclable materials going to landfills and educates the public about waste reduction, reuse, and recycling.
site_name: BROWN COUNTY SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT DISTRICT
service_description: Provides solid waste management information and recycling bins. Accepted items include cardboard, glass bottles (clear, brown, or green), magazines, newspapers, metal food/beverage cans, all plastics EXCEPT Styrofoam, grocery type plastic bags, and PVC pipe.
site_details: Drop items in recycling bin during recycling center hours. Visit the website to find 24/7 recycling locations. www.browncountyrecycles.org
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: BROWN COUNTY SOIL AND WATER CONSERVATION DISTRICT
agency_desc: The mission of the District is to provide information about soil, water, and related natural resource conservation; identify and prioritize local soil and water resource concerns; and connect land users to sources of education, technical, and financial assistance to implement conservation practices and technologies.
site_name: BROWN COUNTY SOIL AND WATER CONSERVATION DISTRICT
service_description: Provides information about soil, water, and related natural resource conservation. Identifies local soil and water resource concerns. Connects land users to sources of education, technical, and financial assistance to implement conservation practices and technologies.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Brown County

agency_desc: Identifies and addresses the literacy needs of children, individuals, and families in Brown County.
service_description: Matches tutors with children needing assistance with reading, comprehension, and math coursework.
site_details: Call for more information. To volunteer, call to request an application.
site_eligibility: To receive tutoring: Living in Brown County -- Grades K-6 -- For Grades 5-6: must have a required reading period each day from 2:30-3:00-- To become a tutor: Must pass background check

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering various social, recreational, and fitness programs.
service_description: Offers programs for all ages, including all-season sports, weight-lifting, aerobics, and swimming lessons. Members pay dues for open access to the fitness center, fitness classes, and pool and receive discounted rates for special programs. Nonmembers pay fixed fees for classes.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website to join or register for specific programs. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open; membership not required for most programs, but members do receive discounts on fees.

agency_desc: Serves as a membership organization that promotes business and economic development.
service_description: Serves as a membership organization that promotes business and economic development in Brown County.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Membership required; call for information

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases,  petitions for emancipation, children in need of services (CHINS), and cases related to traffic violations in Brown County. Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Brown County, the Circuit Court handles all court cases.
site_details: Varies by case type; for information, contact the County Clerk.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court and Brown County juveniles age 17 and under --To file a small claims lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Brown County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Brown County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Brown County

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that offers educational opportunities, individual counseling, and career related services intended to improve the quality of life and earning potential through lifelong learning.
service_description: Provides adult educational opportunities, individual counseling, and career related services. Services include assistance with financial aid forms, career advising and planning, career counseling, college classes, computer classes, free computer access, HSE (High School Equivalency) classes and testing, tutoring, and more.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment. -- Pre-registration required for HSE, CNA, and all other courses.
site_eligibility: Vary by service

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Coordinates lead poisoning case management for youth living within the County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living within the county -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years-old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides emergency utility assistance and a food pantry.
service_description: Provides emergency utility assistance one time a year for those in need. All assistance is provided on a case-by-case basis.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Resident of Brown County -- Have not received assistance in the last year (365 days)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides an animal shelter, including spay and neuter services.
service_description: Offers low-cost spay or neuter surgeries for dogs and cats for low-income households.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed, Fri, Sat, and Sun noon-5pm
Mon, Wed, Fri, Sat, and Sun noon-5pm
Mon, Wed, Fri, Sat, and Sun noon-5pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens.
service_description: Serves as a voter registration site and provides information about voting, candidates, absentee voting, and volunteering to work the polls. Oversees county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Call for information -- Walk in or visit website to register
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc: A nonprofit water utility service that strives to improve the quality of life for its rural service area by supplying its members with quality water at a reasonable cost.
service_description: Provides water service to the majority of Brown County and portions of Bartholomew, Johnson, Monroe, and Morgan counties.
site_details: Call for assistance. Bills may be paid in person, online, by phone, or by mail; a drop box is available at this location.
site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries in Bartholomew, Brown, Johnson, Monroe, and Morgan counties

agency_desc: A natural gas service provider.
service_description: Provides natural gas utility services.
site_details: Call or walk-in for assistance. Bills can be paid by mail, online, in person, or by phone. A drop box is available at this location.
site_eligibility: Addresses with set boundaries in Brown and Bartholomew counties.

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF BROWN COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY FOR BROWN COUNTY
service_description: Accepts donations of building materials in good, usable condition to assist the Brown County Habitat for Humanity.
site_details: Call for information and availability of accepted donations.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Provides water and sanitary sewer utility services for the town of Nashville.
site_details: Call for assistance. Bills may be paid online, in person, or by mail; a drop box is located at this address.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Nashville

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing charitable outreach services, including a clothing pantry and annual back to school event.
site_name: GOD'S GRACE AT BROWN COUNTY PRESBYTERIAN FELLOWSHIP
service_description: Provides free clothing for sizes 3 children to 3X adults, bed and bath linens, and toiletries to those in need (including those who have experienced a fire or other natural disaster). Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in during designated hours. -- After-hours emergency: Call to request an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon 10am-noon; Wed noon-3pm -- After-hours emergencies: By appointment only
Mon 10am-noon; Wed noon-3pm -- After-hours emergencies: By appointment only

Mon 10am-noon; Wed noon-3pm -- After-hours emergencies: By appointment only
Mon 10am-noon; Wed noon-3pm -- After-hours emergencies: By appointment only
site_eligibility: Living in Brown County

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing services to older adults and those with disabilities in Bartholomew, Brown, Decatur, Jackson, and Jennings Counties. Serves as Indiana's Area 11 Agency on Aging for south central Indiana.
service_description: Provides a hot nutritious, sit-down lunch and fellowship for older adults age 60 or older. Reservations at least 24 hours prior are appreciated but not required.
site_details: Call 24 hours in advance to reserve a meal.
site_schedule: Reservations: Mon-Fri 9am-1pm -- Meal Times: Vary by location
site_eligibility: Living in Bartholomew, Brown, Decatur, Jackson, or Jennings County -- Age 60 or older

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Brown County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Brown County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Brown County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Brown County

agency_desc: Nonprofit organization that operates a thrift store, provides clothing and household items to persons in the community and helps with utility bills.
service_description: Provides clothing and housewares to persons who have lost their possessions in a fire.
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Referral from local fire department

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides transportation to medical appointments for area veterans to the veterans' hospital in Indianapolis, Indiana.
site_details: Call at least 3 days in advance to request transportation.
site_eligibility: Veterans living in Brown County -- With an appointment at the veterans' hospital in Indianapolis, Indiana.

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. May provided emergency food assistance and delivery depending on volunteer availability. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in. -- For food emergencies on non-food pantry days, call alternate number and leave a voicemail for return call.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A community mental health agency offering consultation and treatment. Outpatient, case management, therapy, residential, vocational, medical, group, and day programs are available.
service_description: Offers outpatient mental health and addiction services for persons of all ages. Programs include general counseling for individuals and families, anger management, psychiatric disorder treatment, substance abuse assessment and counseling, and intensive outpatient programs (IOP). A 24-hour intake and crisis intervention line is available. Persons in crisis may also receive walk-in services during normal business hours.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call Access Line for intake assessment or to make an appointment. -- For crisis intervention, walk in during normal business hours or call the Crisis Line at any time.
site_schedule: Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm
Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm

Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm
site_eligibility: In need of mental health or addiction services (based on assessment)

agency_name: WOMEN'S RESOURCE CENTER OF BROWN COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides transitional housing for homeless women in a safe, recovery-oriented environment.
site_name: WOMEN'S RESOURCE CENTER OF BROWN COUNTY
service_description: Offers transitional housing for women with or without children who are homeless, experiencing domestic violence, or recovering from addiction. Offers case management to assist in finding permanent housing, employment, and meeting basic needs. Length of stay is determined on a case-by-case basis.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to complete an intake assessment; call before 9pm if possible.
site_schedule: Intake: Daily 24 hours; call before 9pm if possible
Intake: Daily 24 hours; call before 9pm if possible
site_eligibility: Women with or without children -- Age 18 or older -- Without permanent or stable housing as a result of homelessness or domestic violence -OR- Recovering from addiction

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Brown County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority fortheir respectivecounty, including performing the following duties:controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handlesappealof township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st  Wed 9am and the 3rd 6pm
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st  Wed 9am and the 3rd 6pm
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Brown County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Brown County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Brown County

agency_desc: The Brown County Surveyor's Office maintains land mapping and boundaries congruent with the best interests of the county and its citizens through section cornerstones, maintaining the county regulated drain system, and field surveying as necessary.
service_description: Provides the following county services: maintains section corners; files legal surveys; maintains voter precinct maps, annexation, and de-annexation; investigates drainage obstructions; and researches and documents all cemeteries in Brown County.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Bodies
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including financial assistance for rent and utilities.
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance with ONLY utilities. Rent assistance not provided. Limited service area.
site_details: Call to leave voicemail for return call the next business day.
site_eligibility: Living in Brown County -- Limit assistance to once every 12 months

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Brown County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Brown County dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Brown County)

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Nashville in Brown County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Nashville in Brown County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Brown County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Living in Nashville City Limits
